message:
Most of the time, developers don't need to set thread priority or name.

While there are certain *rare* scenarios where you have to think about long-running background operations, in the general case the thread pool recovers from a "stolen" thread in about 2 seconds, so the vast majority of the time using a separate thread for long-running operations is just a premature optimization. The thread pool can handle almost every scenario with long-running background CPU-bound work just fine.

The only real use case for `Thread` these days is to do COM interop.
